query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 ‘Per me si va ne la città dolente, 2 per me si va ne l’etterno dolore, 3 per me si va tra la perduta gente.
query.result: 1 Through me one goes to the city of woe, 2 through me one goes to eternal sorrow, 3 through me one goes among the lost people.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Giustizia mosse il mio alto fattore; 5 fecemi la divina podestate, 6 la somma sapïenza e ’l primo amore.

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Dinanzi a me non fuor cose create 8 se non etterne, e io etterno duro. 9 Lasciate ogne speranza, voi ch’intrate’.
query.result: 7 Before me there were no created things, 8 except eternal ones, and I endure eternally. 9 Abandon all hope, you who enter’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Queste parole di colore oscuro 11 vid’ ïo scritte al sommo d’una porta; 12 per ch’io: «Maestro, il senso lor m’è duro».

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Ed elli a me, come persona accorta: 14 «Qui si convien lasciare ogne sospetto; 15 ogne viltà convien che qui sia morta.

Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Noi siam venuti al loco ov’ i’ t’ho detto 17 che tu vedrai le genti dolorose 18 c’hanno perduto il ben de l’intelletto».
query.result: 16 We have come to the place of which I told you, 17 where you will see the sorrowful people 18 who have lost the good of the intellect”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 E poi che la sua mano a la mia puose 20 con lieto volto, ond’ io mi confortai, 21 mi mise dentro a le segrete cose.
query.result: 19 And after he placed his hand in mine 20 with a joyful face, which comforted me, 21 he led me into the secret things.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Quivi sospiri, pianti e alti guai 23 risonavan per l’aere sanza stelle, 24 per ch’io al cominciar ne lagrimai.
query.result: 22 Here sighs, lamentations and loud wailings 23 resounded through the starless air, 24 so that I wept at the beginning.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Diverse lingue, orribili favelle, 26 parole di dolore, accenti d’ira, 27 voci alte e fioche, e suon di man con elle
query.result: 25 Diverse tongues, horrible languages, 26 words of pain, accents of anger, 27 loud and hoarse voices, and sounds of hands together with them

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 facevano un tumulto, il qual s’aggira 29 sempre in quell’ aura sanza tempo tinta, 30 come la rena quando turbo spira.
query.result: 28 made a tumult, which whirls around 29 forever in that air stained without time, 30 like the sand when a whirlwind blows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 E io ch’avea d’error la testa cinta, 32 dissi: «Maestro, che è quel ch’i’ odo? 33 e che gent’ è che par nel duol sì vinta?».
query.result: 31 And I, who had my head encircled with error, 32 said: “Master, what is that which I hear? 33 And what people are these who seem so overcome in sorrow?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ed elli a me: «Questo misero modo 35 tegnon l’anime triste di coloro 36 che visser sanza ’nfamia e sanza lodo.
query.result: 34 And he to me: “This wretched mode 35 is held by the sad souls of those 36 who lived without infamy and without praise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Mischiate sono a quel cattivo coro 38 de li angeli che non furon ribelli 39 né fur fedeli a Dio, ma per sé fuoro.
query.result: 37 Mingled are with that wicked chorus 38 the angels who were neither rebellious 39 nor faithful to God, but were for themselves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Caccianli i ciel per non esser men belli, 41 né lo profondo inferno li riceve, 42 ch’alcuna gloria i rei avrebber d’elli».
query.result: 40 Heaven casts them out so as not to be less beautiful, 41 and the deep Hell does not receive them, 42 for the wicked would have some glory from them”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E io: «Maestro, che è tanto greve 44 a lor che lamentar li fa sì forte?». 45 Rispuose: «Dicerolti molto breve.
query.result: 43 And I: “Master, what is so grievous 44 to them that makes them lament so loudly?”. 45 He replied: “I will tell you very briefly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Questi non hanno speranza di morte, 47 e la lor cieca vita è tanto bassa, 48 che ’nvidïosi son d’ogne altra sorte.
query.result: 46 These have no hope of death, 47 and their blind life is so base, 48 that they are envious of every other fate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Fama di loro il mondo esser non lassa; 50 misericordia e giustizia li sdegna: 51 non ragioniam di lor, ma guarda e passa».

Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E io, che riguardai, vidi una ’nsegna 53 che girando correva tanto ratta, 54 che d’ogne posa mi parea indegna;

Please translate each line literally into English.
55 e dietro le venìa sì lunga tratta 56 di gente, ch’i’ non averei creduto 57 che morte tanta n’avesse disfatta.
query.result: 55 and behind it came such a long train 56 of people, that I would not have believed 57 that death had undone so many.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Poscia ch’io v’ebbi alcun riconosciuto, 59 vidi e conobbi l’ombra di colui 60 che fece per viltade il gran rifiuto.
query.result: 58 After I had recognized some of them there, 59 I saw and recognized the shade of him 60 who made the great refusal through cowardice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Incontanente intesi e certo fui 62 che questa era la setta d’i cattivi, 63 a Dio spiacenti e a’ nemici sui.
query.result: 61 Immediately I understood and was certain 62 that this was the sect of the wicked, 63 displeasing to God and to his enemies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Questi sciaurati, che mai non fur vivi, 65 erano ignudi e stimolati molto 66 da mosconi e da vespe ch’eran ivi.
query.result: 64 These wretches, who never were alive, 65 were naked and much goaded 66 by gadflies and wasps that were there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Elle rigavan lor di sangue il volto, 68 che, mischiato di lagrime, a’ lor piedi 69 da fastidiosi vermi era ricolto.
query.result: 67 They bathed their faces with blood, 68 which, mingled with tears, was gathered at their feet 69 by loathsome worms.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 E poi ch’a riguardar oltre mi diedi, 71 vidi genti a la riva d’un gran fiume; 72 per ch’io dissi: «Maestro, or mi concedi

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 ch’i’ sappia quali sono, e qual costume 74 le fa di trapassar parer sì pronte, 75 com’ i’ discerno per lo fioco lume».
query.result: 73 that I may know who they are, and what custom 74 makes them seem so ready to cross over, 75 as I discern by the faint light”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Ed elli a me: «Le cose ti fier conte 77 quando noi fermerem li nostri passi 78 su la trista riviera d’Acheronte».
query.result: 76 And he to me: “You will be told the things clearly 77 when we stop our steps 78 on the sad river of Acheron”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Allor con li occhi vergognosi e bassi, 80 temendo no ’l mio dir li fosse grave, 81 infino al fiume del parlar mi trassi.
query.result: 79 Then with downcast and ashamed eyes, 80 fearing that my speech might be burdensome to him, 81 I drew myself back from speech until the river.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Ed ecco verso noi venir per nave 83 un vecchio, bianco per antico pelo, 84 gridando: «Guai a voi, anime prave!
query.result: 82 And behold, an old man, white with ancient hair, 83 came towards us in a boat, 84 crying: “Woe to you, wicked souls!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Non isperate mai veder lo cielo: 86 i’ vegno per menarvi a l’altra riva 87 ne le tenebre etterne, in caldo e ’n gelo.
query.result: 85 Never hope to see heaven: 86 I come to take you to the other shore 87 into eternal darkness, into heat and into ice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E tu che se’ costì, anima viva, 89 pàrtiti da cotesti che son morti». 90 Ma poi che vide ch’io non mi partiva,
query.result: 88 And you who are there, living soul, 89 separate yourself from those who are dead”. 90 But after he saw that I did not leave,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 disse: «Per altra via, per altri porti 92 verrai a piaggia, non qui, per passare: 93 più lieve legno convien che ti porti».
query.result: 91 he said: “By another way, by other ports 92 you will come to the shore, not here, to cross over: 93 a lighter boat must carry you”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 E ’l duca lui: «Caron, non ti crucciare: 95 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 96 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.result: 94 And the leader to him: “Charon, do not be angry: 95 it is willed thus there where that which is willed can be done, 96 and ask no more”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Quinci fuor quete le lanose gote 98 al nocchier de la livida palude, 99 che ’ntorno a li occhi avea di fiamme rote.
query.result: 97 Then the hairy cheeks of the boatman of the livid marsh, 98 who had wheels of flame around his eyes, 99 were quiet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Ma quell’ anime, ch’eran lasse e nude, 101 cangiar colore e dibattero i denti, 102 ratto che ’nteser le parole crude.
query.result: 100 But those souls, who were weary and naked, 101 changed color and chattered their teeth, 102 as soon as they heard the harsh words.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Bestemmiavano Dio e lor parenti, 104 l’umana spezie e ’l loco e ’l tempo e ’l seme 105 di lor semenza e di lor nascimenti.
query.result: 103 They blasphemed God and their parents, 104 the human race and the place and the time and the seed 105 of their engendering and of their births.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Poi si ritrasser tutte quante insieme, 107 forte piangendo, a la riva malvagia 108 ch’attende ciascun uom che Dio non teme.
query.result: 106 Then they all gathered together, 107 weeping loudly, on the evil bank 108 that awaits every man who does not fear God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Caron dimonio, con occhi di bragia 110 loro accennando, tutte le raccoglie; 111 batte col remo qualunque s’adagia.

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Come d’autunno si levan le foglie 113 l’una appresso de l’altra, fin che ’l ramo 114 vede a la terra tutte le sue spoglie,
query.result: 112 As in autumn the leaves fall, 113 one after the other, until the branch 114 sees all its spoils on the ground,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 similemente il mal seme d’Adamo 116 gittansi di quel lito ad una ad una, 117 per cenni come augel per suo richiamo.
query.result: 115 similarly the evil seed of Adam 116 cast themselves from that shore one by one, 117 at a signal like a bird at its call.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Così sen vanno su per l’onda bruna, 119 e avanti che sien di là discese, 120 anche di qua nuova schiera s’auna.
query.result: 118 Thus they go away on the brown wave, 119 and before they have disembarked there, 120 another crowd gathers here.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 «Figliuol mio», disse ’l maestro cortese, 122 «quelli che muoion ne l’ira di Dio 123 tutti convegnon qui d’ogne paese;

Please translate each line literally into English.
124 e pronti sono a trapassar lo rio, 125 ché la divina giustizia li sprona, 126 sì che la tema si volve in disio.
query.result: 124 and they are ready to cross the river, 125 for divine justice spurs them on, 126 so that fear turns into desire.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Quinci non passa mai anima buona; 128 e però, se Caron di te si lagna, 129 ben puoi sapere omai che ’l suo dir suona».

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Finito questo, la buia campagna 131 tremò sì forte, che de lo spavento 132 la mente di sudore ancor mi bagna.
query.result: 130 When this was finished, the dark plain 131 trembled so violently, that from the terror 132 my mind is still bathed in sweat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 La terra lagrimosa diede vento, 134 che balenò una luce vermiglia 135 la qual mi vinse ciascun sentimento;

Please translate each line literally into English.
136 e caddi come l’uom cui sonno piglia.
query.result: 136 and I fell like a man who is overcome by sleep.
